page.title: 16Royston Transport and Travel
page.content: Royston centre is at a crossroads The A14 goes north to Huntingdon The A10 goes south to London and north- east to Cambridge The A505 goes east to Baldock and north-west to Newmarket Royston is at the end of the electrified railway line to Kings Cross, London The express trains take only 45 minutes Diesel trains run to Cambridge, 20 minutes away Some of trains stop at towns and villages on the way Buses go from the bus station to the housing estates in the north and south of Royston. Other buses go to Letchworth,to Cambridge and to the surrounding villages. The buses are run by 5 bus companies. A lot of people use cars or bikes and most families use trains.The rail service is rated as good,but some peo- ple would like a better bus service.
